Description: A flask in the form of Bes seated on a cylindrical stand with top and bottom mouldings. He is naked and sits with the soles of his feet together, and with his hands resting on his thighs. The mouth of the vessel, presumably above a feathered headdress, is lost. Incuse alpha written in base. Three-piece mould: back, front and base. Reduced fabric: micaceous grey-brown Nile silt; black slip overall: Memphis Black Ware.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased Ptolemaic, about second century BC. Comparanda: Same mould-series, perhaps same mould as registration no. 1871,0619.419. Not unlike, same fabric: Edgar 1911: pl. xxv:26315; LIMC iii (2): pl. 83, Bes 67b, left.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3094)
